title: It matters not what you play, It's how you play it.
body:
Don't worry about what you pick. Pick what you want to play, not what's FOTM
Pick champions whose kits you enjoy, not those whose kits are strong.
Build champions how you want to play them, not how Reddit wants you to play them

Because at the end of the day, you'll play better on a weak champ you enjoy, than a strong champ you don't.
You'll play better when you play to your own style, rather than the "meta" playstyle
And, the most important thing:

You'll play better when you do want makes you happy, not what the meta wants you to do.

I've seen Rengar supports do more work than Braums.
I've been stomped by AD Heimerdinger
I've stomped as AP MF.

It's a game, have fun with it. :)

For the record I'm not saying "play off-meta". If you want to play strong champs because you enjoy them, then more power to you, I'm merely saying, don't let the meta restrict your choices of item choices or champion choices, hell, skill is such a major factor is any ELO that isn't Challenger of LCS, it doesn't matter what you play.

EDIT: Holy shit this thread got wayy more attention than I expected, it also got alot more attention than it's EUW counterpart. Thanks for all the comments :)

replies.body:
Or, put another way:

{{champion:154}} It's not how much you can lift, it's how good you look!
{{champion:420}} Live your life, chase what you desire, what else matters?

{{champion:55}} "Come on, live a little... while you can!"

Oh, ok thanks, Katarina- wait.

{{champion:45}} "It's only a short way!? Is that a short joke?" 

wait what were we doing?
I have no idea XD
{{champion:18}} Is that a rocket in your pocket? ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)
{{champion:161}} "Genders are more easily discerned by the pitch of their cries."
{{champion:29}} "Hold still! My eyes are on the side of my head."
{{champion:36}} "Mundo says his own name a lot because sometimes, he forgets. It's happened before."
{{champion:86}} DEMACIAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!!!!!!!!
{{champion:17}} "Sometimes time stands still, and all you can do is watch."
{{champion:114}}:  "I long for 'a wórthy opponent."
{{champion:82}} "You only have to click once, fool!"
{{champion:117}} : That tasted purple!

I agree with everything on here except on thing: in ranked please do not build something that you've never tried before hoping it will work.  I want everyone to have fun playing this game but I also want to not have a game ruined by someone playing a competitive match building willy nilly.
Agreed, no matter what, dont try stuff in ranked.
Hey, when I'm 8/0 as support Vel, I'm darn well going to test luden's echo on him and laugh as 1 q takes off half the enemy adc's hp!
I still play {{champion:121}}.
I have a friend who mains {{champion:121}}. He does WORK!
who downvoted this? btw AP MF support is fun af and is for some reason a massive assist machine. thanks disco heat
Disco Heat is awesome! The thing is, I'm not even saying "play off-meta" I'm just saying: Play what you want.
AD Malzh is my most loved champ right now
I call it Pokemon Trainer Malz. You send out your monster and he does all the work.

the matchistory provided by the client only shows Ranked games if you aren't in my firend list, I only play ranked 5's and I don't do it in preseason :)
If I wanna {{champion:14}} jungle, then I'll {{champion:14}} jungle.  Even if he's not great there anymore.
if i wanna {{champion:254}} {{champion:14}} , then ill get more {{champion:254}} {{champion:14}}

You know what, you're right. It's time to stop caring what other people think about me!
I'm going to play my favorite champion in every lane and every game from now on!
Thank you Good sir :D
- a {{champion:83}} main
{{champion:44}} Top lane. Full armor. Full gem power.
Truly Outrageous
It's not how much time you have. It's how you use it. {{champion:245}}

AD Heimerdinger makes absolutely no sense to be honest. Maybe you got stomped by AD Heimer in a 4v5 but otherwise there is no conceivable way Heimer is going to be useful with that build

Rengar support isn't really a support but if you play a kill lane you can snowball quickly, and AP MF at least used to be a legitimate thing. But AD Heimer? I'm sorry, that's trolling.

I once accidentally picked Kha'Zix when I was supposed to be support. Went bot lane with Targons. My Varus free farmed. I free farmed. The enemy bot lane died. A lot.

Also I've seen stranger adc choices. Ever seen standard adc build Veigar? Vel'Koz? Thresh?

ADC Veigar is ill-advised but at least he will still be getting some AP from his Q passive
ADC Vel'Koz is griefing
ADC Thresh, if you can manage to get enough gold, is hilarious, and actually works to an extent

Standard adc build adc Thresh is awful. One shot Thresh, a fairly similar build, is hilarious and niche.

Adc Vel'koz is superior to adc Veigar. Vel'Koz has two self peel abilities that are relevant and his bases are high as shit. Veigar however has one self peel and horrible bases. Also Vel'Koz has one of the best crit animations in the game

I built him more like a beefy AD bruiser, which worked in Botlane fairly well against opposing laners that lacked long-range pokes, in previous seasons. Something like {{item:3153}}{{item:3047}}{{item:3072}}{{item:3031}} {{item:3143}} on a tanky set of runes/masteries, before the drastic changes to some of these items. Probably doesn't work as well anymore, though :/
Support {{champion:33}} Is funny. I walk up to the ADC with {{item:3075}} and press W and they actually shoot at me.

I haven't touched Khazix in months but, at the height of people complaining he wasn't viable within the past season, I was sending him mid. Khazix is comparatively weak as a jungler but hs ability to curbstomp AP squishies in midlane with just {{item:3156}}{{item:3111}}{{item:3211}} was astounding. Haven't tried it since the rune/mastery tweaks but I bet it's still viable with the right team-comp; Thunderlord's would be deadly in lane.

Heimer has huge AA range and his spells don't scale as hard as most meta-pick mages with a full AP build, plus his passive gives him and the lanemate level-scaling sustain in lane. 

He works as a novelty pick with builds like {{item:3153}}{{item:3124}}{{item:3031}}{{item:3085}}{{item:3033}}{{item:3006}}, which give him potential to snowball provided he comes up with enough gold by late game. Definitely not a good idea in Ranked though lol.
full ad {{champion:64}}  mid's cancer puts riven,yasuo,fizz,zed,jax to shame.
The amount of times full AD Lee Sin has oneshot me are too many to count...

{{champion:64}} :HIKKU!! 


announcer: enemy pentakill!

{{champion:64}}: HEKKUAARGH!
_"A summoner has disconnected."_

And yet, there's always doubt when I go Eve mid. 
I understand. Many have tried. They can't get it to work for them. 
But my best games come from Eve mid-- usually run 19/0 before the other team FF.
Yuss. Love me some eve mid. I go full AP with Rylais and Lich Bane for dirty burst and sustained slows.
What matters is team composition. I'd rather have an AP Corki mid than a zed when we are 100% AD and the enemy team has Rammus and Taric.
